Gouvernement du Canada; Ã‰lections Canada; Division de la gÃ©ographie Ã©lectorale
physique; 30; rue Victoria
Canada

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Canada is divided into 338 electoral districts. A representative or member of Parliament is elected for each electoral district. Following the release of population counts from each decennial census, the Chief Electoral Officer determines the number of seats in the House of Commons and publishes the information in the Canada Gazette. Electoral boundaries commissions then determine the adjustments to the constituency boundaries. The federal electoral boundaries commissions are independent bodies that make all decisions regarding the proposed and final federal electoral boundaries. Elections Canada provides support services to the boundaries commission in each province. Based on reports from these commissions, the Chief Electoral Officer prepares a representation order that describes the boundaries and specifies the name and the population of each FED. The representation order is in force on the first dissolution of Parliament that occurs at least seven months after its proclamation. The 2013 Representation Order (proclaimed on October 5, 2013) was based on 2011 Census population counts, and increased the number of FEDs to 338, up from 308 from the previous 2003 Representation Order. Ontario received fifteen additional seats, Alberta and British Columbia each gained six seats while Quebec added three seats. On June 19, 2014, the Riding Name Change Act, 2014 (Bill C-37) received Royal Assent changing the names of 31 FEDs. The names of FEDs may change at any time through an Act of Parliament.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: A generating station is an industrial facility built and operated to generate electricity. Data shows the 916 generating stations (power plants) operating in 2007. There were 479 hydroelectric stations, 375 thermal plants (combustion, internal combustion and steam), 7 nuclear plants, 54 wind turbines and 1 tidal power plant.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Canadian Railway Network - 1:50 000 comes from the Transport theme of Canvec+ product. It focuses on providing a quality geometric description and a set of basic attributes on Canadian railways, seamlessly across Canada. The Canadian Railway Network is a multi-source product coming mainly from the GeoBase initiative. It contains quality geospatial data (current, accurate, and consistent) of Canadian railway phenomena (including ferry connection for the purpose of railway network continuity). The Canadian Railway Network offers quality topographical information in vector format that comply with international geomatics standards.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Le RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada - 1/50 000 provient du thÃ¨me Transport du produit CanVec+. Il vise Ã fournir une description gÃ©omÃ©trique de qualitÃ© et un ensemble d'attributs de base sur les voies ferrÃ©es canadiennes, sans couture (seamless) sur lâ€™ensemble du Canada. Le RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada est un produit multi-source provenant principalement de l'initiative GÃ©oBase. Il contient des donnÃ©es gÃ©ospatiales de qualitÃ© (actuelles, prÃ©cises et cohÃ©rentes) des phÃ©nomÃ¨nes ferroviaires canadiens (incluant la liaison par transbordeur afin d'assurer un rÃ©seau ferroviaire continu). Le RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada offre une information topographique en format vectoriel basÃ©e sur les normes internationales en gÃ©omatique.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The - Canadian Railway Network - 1:50 000 dataset originates from the integration of data from multiple sources. These sources are from federal or provincial level and the private sector. A single feature may be present in more than one data source. As a starting pont, each of the features was created from the most accurate and up to date source. In some cases, the other sources serve as a complement for acquisition to validate, fix the location or for attribute modification. The first step of the process is to generate the tracks of the main network by integrating the geometries extracted from the best available data source. The data set is then reprojected in CANLAM-CSRS before the completion of the secondary network by adding the tracks of type Siding, Spur, Yard, Connecting, Crossover, Wye, Ferry Route. A UUID (NID) is generated for each of the segment and a process is applied to eliminate those in surplus and add the missing ones. A subdivision name is associated to each Track element geometry. The subdivision names are validated on the main network and than transposed to the secondary network. The data is completed by integration of the features Structure (ex: Bridge, Culvert, Snow Shed, Tunnel, Dam), Crossing, Station, Marker Post, Junction. An automatic process associates each element to a Track segment according to its location indicated in the source dataset used. The location and the attributes are then validated both automatically and interactively when compared to reference data (ex: road network, hydrography network) and orthoimagery. At this stage, the geometry of the network is completed and a subset of the attributes is populated. Before the final validation, the remaining attributes (ex: common attributes to all NRWN datasets, feature metadata) left empty by the preceding processes are populated. The dataset is then validated to verify the network integrity, the topology and the attribute values in conformity to the NRWN model. The errors found in the preceding step are fixed and the dataset is translated in Shape, KML and GML formats. The dataset metadata are generated and all the data is made available on the GeoGratis portal for users to download.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Le jeu de donnÃ©e RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada - 1/50 000 est issu d'une intÃ©gration de plusieurs donnÃ©es provenant de sources diffÃ©rentes. Les donnÃ©es sources sont d'origine fÃ©dÃ©rale, provinciale ou privÃ©e. Une entitÃ© peut Ãªtre prÃ©sente Ã l'intÃ©rieur de plus d'une donnÃ©e source. Comme point de dÃ©part, chaque entitÃ© a Ã©tÃ© crÃ©Ã©e Ã partir de la source la plus Ã jour et la plus prÃ©cise. Dans certains cas, les autres sources ont servis de complÃ©ment d'acquisition, soit pour valider ou corriger le positionnement ou bien pour modifier les attributs. La premiÃ¨re Ã©tape du processus est de gÃ©nÃ©rer les voies du rÃ©seau principal par intÃ©gration des gÃ©omÃ©tries provenant de la meilleure source disponible. Le jeu de donnÃ©es est ensuite reprojetÃ© en CANLAMB-CSRS avant de complÃ©ter le rÃ©seau secondaire en ajoutant les voies de type Ã‰vitement, Ã‰pi, Triage, Bretelle, Liaison, Triangle de virage, Transbordeur. Un UUID (IDN) est gÃ©nÃ©rÃ© pour chaque segment et un traitement est appliquÃ© pour Ã©liminer ceux en trop et ajouter ceux manquants. Ã€ chaque Ã©lÃ©ment des gÃ©omÃ©tries Voie est associÃ© un nom de subdivision. Les noms de subdivision sont validÃ©s sur le rÃ©seau principal et ensuite transposÃ©s sur le rÃ©seau secondaire. Les donnÃ©es sont complÃ©tÃ©es en intÃ©grant les entitÃ©es Structure (ex. : Ponts, Ponceaux, Paraneige, Tunnel, Barrage), Croisement, Gare, Panneau de point milliaire, Jonction. Chaque Ã©lÃ©ment est associÃ© de faÃ§on automatique Ã un segment de Voie selon la position indiquÃ©e dans la donnÃ©e source utilisÃ©e. La position et les attributs sont ensuite validÃ©s de faÃ§on semi-automatique Ã l'aide de donnÃ©es cadres complÃ©mentaires (ex. : rÃ©seau routier, rÃ©seau hydrographique) ainsi que de donnÃ©es satellitaires. Ã€ ce stade la gÃ©omÃ©trie du rÃ©seau est complÃ©tÃ©e ainsi que le peuplement d'un sous-ensemble des attributs. Avant la validation finale, un traitement est exÃ©cutÃ© pour peupler les attributs laissÃ©s vides par les traitements prÃ©cÃ©dents (ex. : attributs commun Ã tous les jeux de donnÃ©es RFN, mÃ©tadonnÃ©es d'entitÃ©s). Le jeu de donnÃ©es est ensuite validÃ© pour vÃ©rifier l'intÃ©gritÃ© du rÃ©seau, la topologie et les valeurs d'attributs selon le modÃ¨le RFN. AprÃ¨s la correction des erreurs du traitement prÃ©cÃ©dent le jeu de donnÃ©es est traduit en format Shape, KML et GML, les mÃ©tadonnÃ©es du jeu de donnÃ©es sont crÃ©Ã©es et les donnÃ©es sont dÃ©posÃ©es sur le portail GÃ©oGratis pour le tÃ©lÃ©chargement par les usagers.
Gouvernement du Canada; Ressources naturelles Canada, Secteur des sciences de la Terre

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Transport Canada (TC) Railway Network data is mainly used to populate the attributes of the Canadian Railway Network - 1:50 000 data. The TC geometries are entered into a process that identifies the corresponding geometries of the Canadian Railway Network data and then assigns the attribute values. The attributes are also populated at the interactive steps of the process. The TC data is also needed to validate the geometries, that is: missing or too many elements, form or location. The final geometries are created by conflation and the application of pre-established rules of use of the attributes from the source dataset. When generating the Crossings of the Canadian Railway Network, the TC data are conflated with other data sources. This group of data is then analysed to determine the best location of the Crossing elements and the attribute values for each of them.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Les donnÃ©es de Transports Canada (TC) sont utilisÃ©es principalement pour peupler les attributs des donnÃ©es du RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada - 1/50 000. La gÃ©omÃ©trie de TC sert d'entrÃ©e dans un traitement qui identifie l'Ã©lÃ©ment correspondant du RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada et ensuite lui assigne les valeurs d'attributs. Le peuplement des attributs se fait Ã©galement en mode interactif. Les donnÃ©es de TC servent aussi Ã valider les gÃ©omÃ©tries soit : les Ã©lÃ©ments en trop ou manquants, la forme, la localisation. Les gÃ©omÃ©tries finales sont crÃ©Ã©es par conflation et l'application de rÃ¨gles prÃ©-Ã©tablies d'utilisation des attributs des donnÃ©es source. Lors de la gÃ©nÃ©ration des Croisements du RÃ©seau ferroviaire du Canada, les donnÃ©es de TC sont amalgamÃ©es aux autres sources de donnÃ©es. Cet ensemble de donnÃ©es est ensuite analysÃ© afin de dÃ©terminer la meilleure localisation des Ã©lÃ©ments Croisement et la valeur des attributs de chacun d'eux.
RFN

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Canadian National (CN) data is used in the processing of the Crossings and Stations features. In both cases, the CN data is conflated with other source datasets. This group of data is than analysed to determine the best location of the Crossing and Station elements and the attribute values for each of them.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Les donnÃ©es du Canadien National (CN) sont utilisÃ©es lors du traitement des entitÃ©s Croisements et Gares. Dans les deux cas, les donnÃ©es du CN sont amalgamÃ©es aux autres sources de donnÃ©es. Cet ensemble de donnÃ©es est ensuite analysÃ© afin de dÃ©terminer la meilleure localisation des Ã©lÃ©ments Croisement et Gare et la valeur des attributs de chacun d'eux.
RFN

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Government of Canada, Natural Resources Canada; Earth Sciences Sector; Canada Centre for Mapping and Earth Observation

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Geospatial Database (GDB) data is used when no provincial data is available to create the National Railway Network (NRWN). Tracks and Structures, are extracted from the GDB data and used as part of the base network. Only the geometric component of the GDB data is used in the creation process of the NRWN elements. No GDB attributes values are used. The Track and Structure features are then conflated with attributes from other data sources. These features are then validated, modified and corrected as need so as to conform to the NRWN model.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Les donnÃ©es de la Base de donnÃ©es gÃ©ospatiale (BDG) sont utilisÃ©es lorsqu'il n'y a aucune donnÃ©e provinciale disponible pour crÃ©er la gÃ©omÃ©trie du RÃ©seau ferroviaire national (RFN). Les Voies et les Structures sont extraites des donnÃ©es de la BDG et utilisÃ©es comme une partie du rÃ©seau de base. Seulement la composante gÃ©omÃ©trique des donnÃ©es de la BDG est utilisÃ©e lors du processus de crÃ©ation des Ã©lÃ©ments du RFN. Aucune valeur d'attribut provenant des donnÃ©es de la BDG n'est utilisÃ©e. Les entitÃ©s Voie et Structure sont alors amalgamÃ©es avec les attributs provenant d'autres sources de donnÃ©es. Ces entitÃ©s sont alors validÃ©es, modifiÃ©es et corrigÃ©es afin de les rendre conformes au modÃ¨le du RFN.
RFN

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Canadian Simplified Hydro Network 1:50 000 comes from the Hydrography theme of Canvec+ product. It focuses on providing a quality geometric description and a set of basic attributes on Canadian hydrographic element, seamlessly across Canada. It is a multi-source product coming mainly from the GeoBase initiative. It contains quality geospatial data (current, accurate, and consistent) of Canadian hydrographic phenomena. It offers quality topographical information in vector format that comply with international geomatics standards. The inferred network linear flow and the islands are excluded for the WMS web service.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Le RÃ©seau hydro simplifiÃ© du Canada - 1/50 000 provient du thÃ¨me hydrographie du produit CanVec+. Il vise Ã fournir une description gÃ©omÃ©trique de qualitÃ© et un ensemble d'attributs de base sur les Ã©lÃ©ments hydrographiques, sans couture (seamless) sur lâ€™ensemble du Canada. C'est un produit multi-source provenant principalement de l'initiative GÃ©oBase. Il contient des donnÃ©es gÃ©ospatiales de qualitÃ© (actuelles, prÃ©cises et cohÃ©rentes) des phÃ©nomÃ¨nes hydrographiques canadiens. Il offre une information topographique en format vectoriel basÃ©e sur les normes internationales en gÃ©omatique. Le filamentaire d'Ã©coulement infÃ©rÃ© et les Ã®les sont exclues pour le service Web WMS.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: When produced by CCMEO using NRCan digital topographic data or provincial data, the production of hydro network datasets is usually contracted-out. A structure and content validation of each Work Unit is performed using validation tools. Various concepts are validated using a series of automatic software or interactively, of which: spatial integrity constraints, attribute values, NID uniqueness, foreign keys (association of a feature to another), composition of features with one another, orientation and priority levels of Network Linear Flows, object metadata, toponymy and the presence/absence of features. All detected inconsistencies are corrected by CCMEO or by the contractor. Inspection processes are adapted according to the data sources.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Lorsque produites par le CCCOT Ã partir de donnÃ©es topographiques numÃ©riques de RNCan ou de donnÃ©es provinciales, la production des jeux de donnÃ©es du rÃ©seau hydro est gÃ©nÃ©ralement effectuÃ©e Ã forfait. Une inspection de la structure et du contenu de chaque UnitÃ© de travail produite est effectuÃ©e Ã lâ€™aide dâ€™outils de validation. Divers concepts sont validÃ©s par une sÃ©rie de logiciels automatiques ou encore de faÃ§on interactive, dont les contraintes dâ€™intÃ©gritÃ© spatiales, les valeurs dâ€™attributs, lâ€™unicitÃ© des IDN, les clÃ©s Ã©trangÃ¨res (association dâ€™une entitÃ© Ã une autre), la composition des entitÃ©s les unes par rapport aux autres, lâ€™orientation et le niveau de prioritÃ© des Filamentaires dâ€™Ã©coulement, les mÃ©tadonnÃ©es objet, la toponymie et la prÃ©sence/absence dâ€™entitÃ©s. Toutes incohÃ©rences dÃ©tectÃ©es sont corrigÃ©es par le CCCOT ou par le sous-traitant. Les processus dâ€™inspection sont adaptÃ©s selon les donnÃ©es sources utilisÃ©es.
Gouvernement du Canada; Ressources naturelles Canada, Secteur des sciences de la Terre

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Canadian Road Network - 1:50 000 comes from the Transport theme of Canvec+ product. It focuses on providing a quality geometric description and a set of basic attributes on Canadian roads, seamlessly across Canada. The Canadian Road Network is a multi-source product coming mainly from the GeoBase initiative. It contains quality geospatial data (current, accurate, and consistent) of Canadian road phenomena (including ferry connection for the purpose of road network continuity). The Canadian Road Network offers quality topographical information in vector format that comply with international geomatics standards.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Le RÃ©seau routier du Canada - 1/50 000 provient du thÃ¨me Transport du produit CanVec+. Il vise Ã fournir une description gÃ©omÃ©trique de qualitÃ© et un ensemble d'attributs de base sur les routes canadiennes, sans couture (seamless) sur lâ€™ensemble du Canada. Le RÃ©seau routier du Canada est un produit multi-source provenant principalement de l'initiative GÃ©oBase. Il contient des donnÃ©es gÃ©ospatiales de qualitÃ© (actuelles, prÃ©cises et cohÃ©rentes) des phÃ©nomÃ¨nes routiers canadiens (incluant la liaison par transbordeur afin d'assurer un rÃ©seau routier continu). Le RÃ©seau routier du Canada offre une information topographique en format vectoriel basÃ©e sur les normes internationales en gÃ©omatique.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The method used for data acquisition is determined by each data provider. The selected method must allow for the acquisition of quality geospatial data (current, accurate, consistent) for the entire dataset. Many acquisition sources are used: GPS, orthoimages, orthophotos, photogrammetry. Maintenance of the Road Network data is done within the framework of intergovernmental partnership agreements (federal, provincial, territorial and municipal) by interested closest to source governmental bodies capable of offering adequate and current representations of the road phenomena.

gmd:textGroup.gmd:LocalisedCharacterString: Chaque fournisseur est libre dâ€™utiliser la mÃ©thode dâ€™acquisition de son choix.
